column4: [   11.146278] vesafb: mode is 640x480x32, linelength=2560, pages=0      how do I change this to 1920x1080x32   ?
cause when ubuntu boots thats the resolution it uses
That resolution is probably to high at the grub menu, you can change it in this file though and run a update-grub afterwards before rebooting. gksudo gedit /etc/default/grub
